judges: Before Bell, O. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell and Mr. Justice Roberts believe the verdict was excessive and would order a new trial.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Judgment affirmed.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell and Mr. Justice Roberts believe the verdict was excessive and would order a new trial.
Mr. Justice Jones dissents.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: William A. Challener, Jr., for appellant.
John M. Feeney, Jr., with him McArdle, Harrington, Feeney & McLaughlin, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Craig v. Fulton, Appellant.
Argued October 2, 1964.
Before Bell, O. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
William A. Challener, Jr., for appellant.
John M. Feeney, Jr., with him McArdle, Harrington, Feeney & McLaughlin, for appellees.
November 10, 1964:
